qas.question: What type of engines became widespread around the end of the 19th century?
What are the stages in a compound engine called?
In what field were double and triple expansion engines common?
What product was notably shipped in vessels equipped with double and triple expansion engines?
Along with electric motors, what power sources overtook steam engines in the 20th century?
What type of engines became widespread around the end of the 20th century?
What are the stages in an efficiency engine called?
In what field were double and triple expansion replacements common?
What product was notably shipped in vessels equipped with double and triple replacement engines?
Along with electric motors, what power sources overtook expansion engines in the 20th century?

context: Near the end of the 19th century <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>compound<b5_0/><a0_1/><a0_0/> engines<a0_2/> came into widespread use. Compound engines exhausted steam in to successively larger cylinders to accommodate the higher volumes at reduced pressures, giving improved efficiency. These stages were called <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>expansions<b6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>, with double and triple expansion engines being common, especially in <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2>shipping<a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> where efficiency was important to reduce the weight of <a3_0><a3_1><b8_0>coal<b8_0/><a3_1/><a3_0/> carried. Steam engines remained the dominant source of power until the early 20th century, when advances in the design of electric motors and <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b9_0>internal combustion engines<b9_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> gradually resulted in the replacement of reciprocating (piston) steam engines, with <b7_0>shipping<b7_0/> in the 20th-century relying upon the steam turbine.
